thread.title: Gertrude Woodard Taylor, mother of James Taylor, dead at 94
thread.title_full: Gertrude Woodard Taylor, mother of James Taylor, dead at 94 - UPI.com

author: Karen Butler
title: Gertrude Woodard Taylor, mother of James Taylor, dead at 94
text:
| License Photo CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Oct. 12 (UPI) -- Gertrude Woodard Taylor, the mother of singer-songwriter James Taylor , has died at the age of 94, the musician announced on his website Monday.
"I'm deeply grateful for all the kind words of sympathy and condolence that people have been sending in these past two days," Taylor wrote in a post, along with an obituary for his mother, whom he noted was an accomplished painter, the daughter of a Massachusetts fisherman and the wife of a North Carolina doctor.
"She devoted her life to her marriage and her five children, four boys and a girl, all born in the span of six years between 1947 and 1953," the 67-year-old, Grammy winner said of his mother.
"She raised us in the home she built in Chapel Hill, N.C. and, since she never lost her Maritime New England roots, made an annual summer migration to Martha's Vineyard Island," he added. "She ended her days in her simple, elegant cottage overlooking her beloved Stonewall Pond, surrounded by dear friends and four generations of family. As she liked to say: 'Life is finite, but love lasts forever.'"
  Jared Leto, Mark Ruffalo don disguises to mingle at New York Comic Con Rapper Scarface arrested after BET Hip-Hop Awards in Atlanta Pippa Middleton and beau Nico Jackson split up Jim Carrey attends girlfriend Cathriona White's funeral in Ireland
